thread.title: A Nice, Sweet Hotel <3
thread.title_full: A Nice, Sweet Hotel <3 - Review of Est Hotel Paris, Paris, France - TripAdvisor

author: Eva T
title: A Nice, Sweet Hotel <3
text:
I have to be honest, that this hotel was the "savior" on our trip in France. Because, unfortunately, we were having hard time finding person that can speak English when we arrived at Gare du Lyon. SO, to met a nice and well-English-spoken FO woman, was a total relief :D
So, the hotel's location is strategic. Near the metro, near groceries store, and just by the main street. So, it was easy for us to just went across the street to buy some food, even in the late night :D - Love it. Since the other country I stayed in Europe wasn't that alive at night :D
The Price - Affordable. When we compared it to other hotel we've stayed during our eurotrip. Or perhaps, just because we just happened to arrived from Switzerland (which was sehr teuer), so then Paris seemed cheaper :p
The Room - It was large. Like a large 1 bedroom Apartment. the main room consists of 2 single bedroom, and the smaller room consist of one single bedroom.
The sheets were super cute! :D The heater is available in each room: main room, small room, and bathroom.
The Bathroom - Love it. Thy provide the standard toiletries, and oh they have bathtub! Yay! I soaked myself in the bathtub for an hour. hahaha...
The Food - we didn't have tie to take breakfast, so I couldn't give any review about their F&B.
The view that we had was amazing! I love to kept my windows opened :D
I do love the hotel, and they still used a vintage key XD not to mention, the employees were so friendly and helpful.
They helped you for direction to places you wanted to go, and also if you need taxi to go to the airport or Train station, just asked them to call it for you :D
The wifi service was okay, not so strong, IMO.
I'd recommend this hotel to anyone :D
Room Tip: Ask for the room with the view on the street. The view from your window is sooo good :D See more room tips
